metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0432 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In skb_to_mamac of networking.c, there is a possible out of bounds writedue to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: AndroidkernelAndroid ID: A-143560807

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0432` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-177-generic - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-4.4.0-177-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-4.4.0-177-lowlatency - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-4.4.0-177-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-4.4.0-177-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-4.4.0-177-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-4.4.0-177-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-177-generic - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-177-lowlatency - 4.4.0-177.207
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-177.207').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-96.97~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1069.76').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1105.116').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1065.69~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1077.82').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.64').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.41~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1131.140').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.143').
